intro: Sideritis crenata, commonly known as the serrated sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are serrated and have a slightly minty scent, contributing to its use in traditional herbal medicine. Sideritis crenata is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
